page.title: 08 The Supermarket
page.content: There is one large shop in the old village centre:Lipton's supermarket. It is run by 20 staff, shared among the main store and the butchery, fruit, vegetables and provisions departments. Stock is delivered from the wholesale depot each weekday, and takes only a few minutes to come from Dumpton Park. Perishable goods such as milk, butter, yogurt and cream have only a two day life, though some dairy items last 7 to 10 days before they must be removed from the shelves. The assistant manager told us the biggest worry for a large shop is the keeping of frozen food. If there is a power failure, things can be covered in metal foil for a short time, but there is no back-up generator in the event of a long term failure. About 5000 people use the store each week, mostly from within walking distance.
